subject: Re: [junit] Test order in a TestSuite random on JDK7
msgSnippet: ... Thanks David for your Ordered extends BlockJUnit4ClassRunner solution. The problem however is that majority of our tests are still using JUnit3. Is there
messageBody:
> If
> you want reproducibility for tests without that property, you can
> implement it yourself.

Thanks David for your "Ordered extends BlockJUnit4ClassRunner" solution. The
problem however is that majority of our tests are still using JUnit3. Is there
a suggested way to convince JUnit3 runner to order the tests?

>## 22. 8. 2011 21:08:47 ##<
> It sounds like you want JUnit to do more for you.

I'd like a way to reproduce the failure on a continuous build server locally
to help me find problems in existing tests and make them properly isolated.

> I'm satisfied with the current situation but I hear
> that you aren't.

Currently I see little support to help me analyze failures related to random
execution order of test methods. Here in given advices may help for JUnit4,
but not for our existing JUnit3 test suites harnessed by Ant.
-jt
